org.mindswap.owls.process.execution
Interface ExecutionContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseExecutionContext
public interface ExecutionContext

Execution contexts provide information used by execution engines to drive execution of processes.

This interface defines basic methods required in any case to maintain a current state of process variables during execution (sometimes also referred to as the whiteboard). Sub interfaces may freely extend it to manage additional context information as used by custom execution engines.

Method Summary

Method Detail

addInputs

ValueMap<Input,OWLValue> addInputs(ValueMap<Input,OWLValue> inputs,
                                   boolean returnPreviousValues)
Add the given collection of input variable bindings to this context. Input variable bindings already contained in this context will be updated as given by the value mapping (whereby the value may be null, thus, leaving the input unbound) and the previous value will be included in the returned mapping.

Parameters:
inputs - The collection of input variable bindings to add.
returnPreviousValues - Determines whether the previous value bindings should be returned (true) or not (false).
Returns:
null if returnPreviousValues == true. Map containing the previous value bound to a variable if the value was re-assigned as a result of this method invocation.

addLocals

ValueMap<Local,OWLValue> addLocals(ValueMap<Local,OWLValue> locals,
                                   boolean returnPreviousValues)
Add the given collection of local variable bindings to this context. Local variable bindings already contained in this context will be updated as given by the value mapping (whereby the value may be null, thus, leaving the local unbound) and the previous value will be included in the returned mapping.

Parameters:
locals - The collection of local variable bindings to add.
returnPreviousValues - Determines whether the previous value bindings should be returned (true) or not (false).
Returns:
null if returnPreviousValues == true. Map containing the previous value bound to a variable if the value was re-assigned as a result of this method invocation.

addOutputs

ValueMap<Output,OWLValue> addOutputs(ValueMap<Output,OWLValue> outputs,
                                     boolean returnPreviousValues)
Add the given collection of output variable bindings to this context. Output variable bindings already contained in this context will be updated as given by the value mapping (whereby the value may be null, thus, leaving the output unbound) and the previous value will be included in the returned mapping.

Parameters:
outputs - The collection of output variable bindings to add.
returnPreviousValues - Determines whether the previous value bindings should be returned (true) or not (false).
Returns:
null if returnPreviousValues == true. Map containing the previous value bound to a variable if the value was re-assigned as a result of this method invocation.

getInputs

ValueMap<Input,OWLValue> getInputs()
Returns:
A filtered view of all input variable bindings in this context.

getLocals

ValueMap<Local,OWLValue> getLocals()
Returns:
A filtered view of all local variable bindings in this context.

getOutputs

ValueMap<Output,OWLValue> getOutputs()
Returns:
A filtered view of all output variable bindings in this context.

getValues

ValueMap<ProcessVar,OWLValue> getValues()
Returns:
The union of getInputs(), getLocals(), and getOutputs().

isCachingPermitted

boolean isCachingPermitted()
Returns:
true if execution can use caching in order to boost performance.
